children.subject: Interesting... it could have been in error and if so I apologize. I went through and removed everyone who was listed with an address that ended in .com. Not sure why yours would have been deleted if it didn't fall into that category.
That's probably because my Berkeley address is not my primary address, it's a secondary address. But I don't want it to be my primary address (Piazza is not special to Berkeley after all).

Is there no way for you to check secondary addresses? I know instructors have previously enrolled me based on my Berkeley address just fine, but I'm guessing Piazza doesn't show those to you. If you feel this is necessary then it might be worth submitting a feature request to Piazza on behalf of the department requesting that you be able to see someone's school address instead of removing students who did nothing wrong. Removing without some kind of ban isn't all that effective given students can just re-enroll anyway, it's just a game of whack-a-mole with collateral damage to the rest of us.
I can see it now; couldn't before. Not sure why. Thanks for your understanding.
That's weird, nothing changed on my end, so unless Piazza changed what email address it registers for enrolling students I'm not sure why that would happen. But thanks for looking into it!
Can confirm this also happened to me. I've also made a post in the erroneous Spring 2017 EECS 101 redirecting them here.
yeah same. Not mad or anything. I trust that it was simply a clerical error but if it helps to know, I did get removed as well despite my berkeley email being on my profile

You removed me even though I do have my @berkeley.edu email listed on my account, I haven't been trolling or even posting anonymously for that matter, and the other email address on my account also had my full name on it...
I can use "Anonymous to Classmates" just fine right now. Is it actually disabled for you? Can you try a different browser and/or post a screenshot?

Oh wait I guess I misread the post then. So basically the post is not saying we can't be anonymous in our posts, but we just need to make a real account so that way there is no trolling without consequences? I take everything back, I really like this!

You can still be anonymous to each other, just not to admins. And in the event that harassment/trolling is going on, we need to know what your real name is so we can hold folks accountable. Hope this clears things up.

Wait so I still see the option to be Anon to classmates, is that still on, but we're not allowed to pick it? And is this rule only in regards to followup discussion posts or all posts on EECS 101 Piazza? 

Anyway I'm not too big a fan of this rule. One thing is that personal posts (like the one asking advice on what to do based on his/her financial status) probably won't be asked anymore publicly, instead becoming private posts. I think the anon who posted gained some great advice and there were many supportive followups, even if it might have been better to make it a private post. Of course, I also saw the really unnecessary racist followup and I think one thing Piazza needs is a report button, if they ever implement that.

history.content:
Dear Piazza community; 

It has come to our attention that some people are using the anonymity of Piazza to make this a hostile place. This is not acceptable. Piazza is intended to be a supportive and welcoming community where students can come to ask each other questions.  
Beginning today, if you wish to use piazza, you will be required to use your @berkeley.edu email address. Posts using any other email address will be removed. You are welcome to sign back up with your @berkeley.edu email address if you are deleted. In addition, you must use your real name. Those who are found to be using aliases will be removed. We apologize for the inconvenience, but feel this is necessary to ensure our students are being respected and supported.
Please note: if your post is perceived by administrators as trolling, you will be removed from Piazza. 
Thank you for helping to maintain our supportive Piazza community. 
- The Center for Student Affairs Staff
history.subject: IMPORTANT: Trolling on Piazza
